Course.Name: Internet Programming
Course.Description: Introduction to web application programming. Covers the fundamentals of developing applications for web browsers, within the dominant HTTP-based client/server model. A wide range of technologies and development methodologies are covered, including database and server architectures, serer-side frameworks, client-side languages/libraries, remote invocation models and web application security. Specific topics in web development change rapidly, but some examples include SQL, HTML, TLS, PHP, Java EE (servllets, JSP, etc), ASP.NET.

Restrictions2.item: May not be enrolled in English Language Institute
